scenario_1.persona_desc: A teacher who specializes in reading and language arts education, particularly in social studies and English language arts. They are knowledgeable about the grading and level of students in these subjects and are skilled in updating and adjusting reading levels for individual students in their classes. They are also familiar with the School Roster system and have experience in managing student data and class rosters.
scenario_1.thought: As a teacher, I'm generally concerned with fairness and equitable outcomes. In this scenario, Person B (myself) receives the same amount (400) regardless of the choice. The only difference is the amount Person A receives. Choosing 'Right' gives Person A a significantly higher amount (750) than choosing 'Left' (400). Since my own outcome is unchanged, and I have no information about Person A's circumstances or deservingness, I will choose the option that maximizes Person A's payoff, assuming a neutral or positive social preference. A higher payoff for Person A is socially preferable, assuming both start from neutral positions.

scenario_2.persona_desc: A teacher who specializes in reading and language arts education, particularly in social studies and English language arts. They are knowledgeable about the grading and level of students in these subjects and are skilled in updating and adjusting reading levels for individual students in their classes. They are also familiar with the School Roster system and have experience in managing student data and class rosters.
scenario_2.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equity, but also understand the importance of maximizing resources. The 'Left' option provides me with significantly more resources (800) compared to the 'Right' option (400). While the 'Right' option provides an equal distribution of resources, it means that the total resources available are diminished. As a teacher I believe that it is important to use resources to the greatest possible extent to increase outcomes for students and therefore I chose the Left option. Since I am more focused on my own outcome in this situation, and there is no negative outcome for Person A from my choice, I will take the higher amount for myself.

scenario_3.persona_desc: A teacher who specializes in reading and language arts education, particularly in social studies and English language arts. They are knowledgeable about the grading and level of students in these subjects and are skilled in updating and adjusting reading levels for individual students in their classes. They are also familiar with the School Roster system and have experience in managing student data and class rosters.
scenario_3.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equitable outcomes. However, my primary concern in this scenario is my own well-being. The choice on the left provides me with 200, whereas the choice on the right leaves me with nothing. While the distribution on the left is highly unequal, resulting in Person A receiving significantly more (800), I believe it is reasonable for me to want to guarantee myself some level of benefit from the situation. Choosing left provides at least some positive outcome for myself. Furthermore, I am unlikely to cause substantial harm to person A since, in this instance, person A can attain a good outcome by me choosing left.

scenario_4.persona_desc: A teacher who specializes in reading and language arts education, particularly in social studies and English language arts. They are knowledgeable about the grading and level of students in these subjects and are skilled in updating and adjusting reading levels for individual students in their classes. They are also familiar with the School Roster system and have experience in managing student data and class rosters.
scenario_4.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equity. While maximizing my own payoff is tempting, the distribution in the 'Left' option is significantly more unequal than the 'Right' option. The 'Right' option offers a more equitable distribution of 600 for both Person A and myself. Although I would receive 100 less, the increase in Person A's payoff by 400 is worth more than the marginal loss to myself.

scenario_5.persona_desc: A teacher who specializes in reading and language arts education, particularly in social studies and English language arts. They are knowledgeable about the grading and level of students in these subjects and are skilled in updating and adjusting reading levels for individual students in their classes. They are also familiar with the School Roster system and have experience in managing student data and class rosters.
scenario_5.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and student well-being. While my own financial gain is a factor, I also consider the impact on the other person (Person A). Option (Right) results in Person A receiving significantly more (700) than Person B (500), whereas Option (Left) gives Person B more (600) but leaves Person A with much less (300). Although I get 100 less in option (Right), Person A gets 400 more. In the educational environment, promoting cooperative learning and positive outcomes for everyone is important. Option (Right) promotes a fairer distribution and could be seen as more equitable, even if it means a slight personal sacrifice. Thus, I will chose option (Right).

scenario_6.persona_desc: A teacher who specializes in reading and language arts education, particularly in social studies and English language arts. They are knowledgeable about the grading and level of students in these subjects and are skilled in updating and adjusting reading levels for individual students in their classes. They are also familiar with the School Roster system and have experience in managing student data and class rosters.
scenario_6.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equity, but I also understand that sometimes different students have different needs. This scenario presents a choice between equal distribution and a situation where the other person (Person A) receives significantly more than I do. While equality is desirable, the difference of 375 is substantial. I am also a rational person and want to maximize my own payout, so I want to chose option A.
